event.title: shown here with population as of 2010

data.event: San Jose is politically subdivided into 14 barangays, shown here with population as of 2010 Census: Basak - 888 Basiao - 596 Cambaloctot - 557 Cancawas - 1,527 Janayjanay - 933 Jilocon - 1,728 Naiba - 671 Poblacion - 1,035 San Roque - 816 Santo Niño - 2,195 Señora Ascion (Calo) - 1,690 Siapo - 2,136 Tampi - 1,837 Tapon Norte - 2,489 The municipality of San Jose was formerly called "Ayuquitan", a name that was born due to a communication problem between the natives and Spanish Conquistadors.
In 1902 Governor Demetrio Larena considered the place as a pueblo.
